result.execSummary:
The defendant Nomar Melendez-Valentin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Nomar Melendez-Valentin in court.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
  Sworn as interpreter:  Brenda Bartholomew
  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.
Probation Review Hearing scheduled for February 12, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Nomar Melendez-Valentin in court with Attorney Eduardo M. Borda.  Peter A. Hahn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State and defense counsel as to sentencing.

As to Count 2:
Court ordered defendant to serve 4  MONTHS in the House of Correction consecutive to any sentence.

Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on probation for 12 MONTHS with the following conditions:
- Court ordered 20 days in the House of Correction; stayed for the use at the discretion of the probation department.
- Attend and successfully complete an Anger Mgmnt. program
- Mental Health evaluation and comply with any recommended treatment
- Comply with any treatment or programming ordered by probation
- AODA assessment; comply with any recommended treatment.
- Absolute Sobriety
- No drugs without a valid prescription
- No contact with the victim without the approval of the court or the probation agent
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- Pay all costs, fees, assessmsents and surcharges.  Any cash bail posted on this case to be applied to costs and surcharges owed.
- No contact with firearms
- Attend the probation review hearing on 02-12-2016.

Received and filed:  Spanish language Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
Clerk:  jms

Defendant Nomar Melendez-Valentin in court with attorney Eduardo M. Borda.  Patrick D. Winter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sworn as interpreter:  Alberto Aguilar
AS to count 1, Battery, court orders count dismissed and read in.
AS to count 2, CDTP:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.
Case adjourned for sentencing to 10-22-2015.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 22, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Based upon statement to the court by Lenie A. via interpreter, the court will modify to NO VIOLENT CONTACT ORDER with the condition that parties do not reside together.  Lenie A is ordered to appear on the trial date.
The court admonished defendant that violation of no contact order may result in bail jumping charges being issued.

Defendant Nomar Melendez-Valentin in court with attorney Eduardo M. Borda.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sworn as interpreter: Dawn Maldonado.
Amended Criminal Complaint is filed by the state to which the defense has no objection and maintains NOT GUILTY pleas as to each count.
Case set for final pretrial on 10-8-2015 at 8:15am.  Jury trial set for 10-19-2015 at 8:15am.  All final pretrial documents to be filed by the final pretrial hearing.  
  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 8, 2015 at 08:15 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 19, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Sworn as interpreter: Alexandra Wirth.   mld

Defendant Nomar Melendez-Valentin in court with Attorney Brian Hagner for Attorney Eduardo M. Borda.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sworn as Spanish Interpreter: Alexandra Wirth.  
Discovery and offer received by defense counsel.  Parties are advised that EFFECTIVE August 3, 2015, this case will be assigned to JUDGE WAGNER, BRANCH 38, in Room 504 in the Courthouse.  Case adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference in Branch 38 on 8-4-2015 at 8:15 am.   mld

Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: Lenin AF (dob: 6/18/85) or his residence.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  
Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.

Defendant Nomar Melendez-Valentin in court with attorney Jamie Marie Mcclendon.  
Defendant Nomar Melendez-Valentin in custody.  
Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Spanish Interpreter sworn: Alexandria Wirth  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
